clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Hyperbilirubinaemia on Two Different Near Infrared Spectroscopy Devices
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Hyperbilirubinaemia on Foresight and INVOS Oximetry Values in Pediatric Hepatic Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: Protocol Near infrared spectroscopy liver transplants: comparison of two monitoring of Near infrared spectroscopy in pediatric liver transplant.

detailed_description.textblock: Hyperbilirubinaemia may interfere with oximetry values as measured by Near Infrared Spectroscopy devices. The number of wave lengths used by different devices can influence the oximetry values in adult patients. This has never been demonstrated in children with hyperbilirubinaemia scheduled for elective liver transplantation.The study will compare cerebral and somatic oximetry values measured by two different Near infrared spectroscopy devices (FORESIGHT and INVOS) and analyse the influence of bilirubin levels on these differences.

primary_outcome.measure: influence of chromophores such as bilirubin on oximetry values provided by two different devices
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 of surgery until arrival at pediatric intensive care unit (up to 12 hours)
primary_outcome.description: measure of oximetry values by two different devices at different time points in function of serum bilirubin levels

arm_group.description: Using somatic and cerebral Near infrared spectroscopy devices

intervention.intervention_name: Near infrared spectroscopy with INVOS device
intervention.description: somatic and cerebral oximetry by INVOS in pediatric liver transplantation

intervention.intervention_name: Near infrared spectroscopy with Foresight device
intervention.description: somatic and cerebral oximetry with Foresight device in pediatric liver transplantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients 0 to 18 years, with a liver transplant with living donor program of our institution
- Free, informed and written consent signed by the investigator or employees and by the legal guardians of minor patients in the days preceding the procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal of the patient or his parents to consent
- known brain or Neurological pathology
